column4: someone can tell me what happens if i disable the filesystem check in the boot?
it wont check the other non / file systems i think. which isnt really a big deal
so i can disable it and nothing bad would happen with time?

not any more bad than would happen normally. the only diff is that you might have to run fsck yourself if something became corrupt and you started having problems. its a diff between ubuntu doing it for you or you doing it
